articles.title: AstraZeneca vaccine: University of Oxford "AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine side effects" Nigeria update - BBC News

articles.author: Rebecca Robbins, Thomas Erdbrink
articles.content:
Italys suspension of a different batch was tied to a man in Sicily who died after receiving his shot. Its unclear whether a blood clot was involved.
More than 142,000 people in Denmark, which has a … [+1974 chars]
articles.description: Millions of people have received the vaccine without safety problems, and there is no evidence of any causal link between the vaccine and blood clots.
articles.title: European Countries Suspend Use of AstraZeneca Shots Over Worries About Blood Clots - The New York Times

articles.content: Denmark has temporarily suspended use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca covid-19 vaccine as a precautionary move after reports of blood clots and one death. However, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) and t… [+4103 chars]
articles.description: Denmark has temporarily suspended use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca covid-19 vaccine as a precautionary move after reports of blood clots and one death. However, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) and the UK’s regulatory body have said that there is no indicatio…
articles.title: Covid-19: European countries suspend use of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine after reports of blood clots - The BMJ

articles.author: AFP
articles.description: THE HAGUE: Europe’s medicines regulator said Thursday there appeared to be no higher risk of blood clots in those vaccinated against Covid-19, after Denmark, Norway and Iceland suspended use of the AstraZeneca jab.
articles.title: Blood-clot risk 'no higher' in vaccinated people: EMA - New Straits Times

articles.title: EMA expected to approve one-shot J&J vaccine - RTE.ie

articles.description: Antoine Griezmann admitted Barcelona were "gutted" after going out of the Champions League in the last 16 on Wednesday, as a 1-1 draw away to Paris Saint-Germain saw the Catalans lose 5-2 on aggregate.
articles.title: Barcelona 'gutted' at earliest European exit in 14 years - SuperSport
